Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very clean friendly, good pool, nice quiet and good toys for children We would certainly stay there again Only 9 euro in a cab to town, easy walk to the rail and bull ring. Only thing is the service at the bar can be slow as only one staff, she was great just busy

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel once we found it!”
Reviews.Author: glendaiw
Reviews.Content: Friendly, clean, spacious hotel with swimming pool - great once we had found it. We followed the directions on the hotel website coming from Andalucia - but we never found junction 5 of the M30 so we followed signs to the airport and started again with the directions from there - still did not find the hotel. Luckily we did find one of the roads mentioned and my husband said we would do a turn at the upcoming roundabout - and low and behold the hotel was right on that roundabout - no mention of a roundabout in the instructions! The No 53 bus to the centre of Madrid (Puerto du Sol) stops outside and is 1.5 euros each. Buses are frequent and run until fairly late in the evening - we did not dare take the car out of the car park once we had found the hotel. Bedroom was clean and comfortable with full length electrically operated black out blinds. It had wifi and tea and coffee (paper cups) and minibar. The showerroom was well equipped. When returning from Madrid we had a drink on the terrace overlooking the swimming pool which had ever changing coloured lights - very attractive, even if there was some noise from the road. Breakfast was a fairly substantial buffet but cost 15 euros. Parking 12 euros but very secure and underground. We would stay here again if visiting Madrid. Receptionist's instructions for reaching the airport were much more accurate than those on the website.

Reviews.Title: “A family friendly hotel. Surely to be recommeded for your stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A clean, kids friendly hotel. Strategically located for easy access to the city center of SOL. Down sides are the very small swimming pool for a large hotel. My kids did not feel comfortable enough to visit the crowded swimming pool. The aircondition system was very good but not strong enough to cool the 36-40 degree summer heat wave in madrid. They could also think of improving the variety of food offered for breakfast. All in all. A good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: globalcitizen27
Reviews.Content: We stayed there last week.The hotel was nearly perfect.The location was good, may be not at the city center but the bus#53 takes Puerta Del Sol and the bus stop was a few metres away.the only problem occured in our first room, we were bitten by insects(not mosquitoes, probably mites)but they compensated by an upgraded room and offered drinks at the bar.In general , I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good stay, typical Novotel”
Reviews.Author: JCW_UK
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults and 2 teenagers) stayed for 3 nights in 2 rooms in mid August. The hotel is modern although the carpets in the bedroom corridors looked a little tired and could do with replacing before too long. The rooms themselves were of a good standard, clean, nicely air conditioned and adequate space. Breakfast buffet was excellent and had both hot and cold choices. We used the swimming pool once and again this was to a good standard. We used the bus service into the city centre which was very frequent and efficient - journey time about 25 mins. Overall I would recommend this hotel if you want good value for money and don't want to be right in the hustle and bustle of the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Brownwater Hotel - No Bueno!”
Reviews.Author: WalrusOne
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night on business. One colleague was in another room with same feelings. I would never recommend this hotel. The room smelled musty and the window does not open. The mattress was a futon on a piece of plywood - no box spring - very uncomfortable. But I saved the worst for last. When I woke to get my shower, I was surprised to see brown colored water coming from the tap in the bathroom sink. I assumed there was some rust in the line so I turned the tub hot water on to flush it out while I shaved and brushed my teeth. Unfortunately it never went away and I had to take a cold shower. When I met my colleague in the lobby we looked at one another and said "your room too?". The answer was "si" and if you are considering staying here the answer should be "no, oh heck no"

Reviews.Title: “A Tale of Two Rooms”
Reviews.Author: OhioRon
Reviews.Content: First of all, this is a very nice hotel. The lobby is spacious and the front desk staff is friendly and efficient. WiFi is free throughout and there are two free computers in the lobby. I had some problems the food service. I tried to eat in the hotel three times. I went to the bar for lunch one day and tried their special (less than ten Euros for a sandwich, fries, salad, and drink). But there was only one person working and she was clearly overwhelmed. There were a bunch of us there, and it took a very long time to get served. The food itself was OK when it finally arrived, but nothing special. It also took a long time to pay since the worker (the only one) just disappeared for about 10 minutes. The breakfast seems greatly overpriced. The continental option is 7.50 Euros for one cup of coffee, one glass of juice, and a couple of pastries. It’s not a continental buffet. The full buffet is 14.50 Euros but wasn't too satisfying to me. Not much selection and not too tasty. In our first room there was a problem with the air conditioner (it didn't blow cold air). They came to the room and said they fixed it but they didn't. On our second day they said they would work on it while we're away and it would be fixed when we returned. It wasn't. So, after two nights in a hot room, we spent the last two nights in a comfortable room. The two rooms were quite different, so I'll describe both. All rooms in the hotel have one king bed and one sofa that can be turned into a double bed. Our first room, on the eighth floor, had a TV mounted on the wall and a stocked minibar. There was enough room left in the minibar for us to chill a couple bottles of water. The bed was comfortable and the room was bright and cheery. The bathroom had a tub/shower and outlets for shavers. You need to be careful using the shower because, if you touch the glass partition, water will spill onto the bathroom floor. The size of the room itself was a comfortable size, neither large nor small. Our second room, on the fifth floor, had a small TV sitting on the desk (not mounted on the wall). The bath had only a walk-in shower, no tub. The partition did a good job of keeping water from getting on the floor. This room has a room darkening shade that raises and lowers with a switch that is beside the bed. The first room didn’t have that. The hotel is not centrally located but there is a bus (number 53) that takes you directly to the Prado and other attractions. There are two metro stops within walking distance—one in a nice neighborhood and the other in a less nice neighborhood. You get to the nicer one by walking across the bridge and turning left. The metro system is quite easy to use and, in July 2012, the price is only 12 Euros for 10 tickets. We had a group of four so that was enough for the four of us to have a round trip and have two tickets left over. A single ride on the metro or a bus is 1.20 Euros. It’s worth noting that, according to one guidebook, there are more than 15,000 taxis in Madrid. It is VERY easy to find one, and they are really CHEAP. We used taxis when the metro wasn’t convenient, and the most we ever paid was 5 Euros. If you ever want a taxi, just look around. You’ll see dozens no matter where you are. Despite our difficulties with our first room and with the food, I thought this was a comfortable hotel and the people were very nice. That’s why I rated it four stars.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and pool”
Reviews.Author: peter s
Reviews.Content: We (2A, 2C) stayed 3 nights at the end of June. Very nice hotel, comfy typical Novotel room, but sofa bed was really too small for our two children (aged 7 and 10). Annoyingly, we were woken every morning by someone wanting to collect laundry - we never had any because the prices were extortionate (blouse 6.20 Eu and another 3.20 for ironing, undies 2.58, socks 1.75) so not sure why she kept coming back, but would recommend sticking out the do not disturb sign overnight - we kept forgetting. Friendly reception has good maps of Madrid. Free wifi. Free Apple computers and X-boxes in lobby. Fantastic pool with lots of sun loungers and a handy bar. We thought the bar food was great; kids particularly loved the 4 cheeses pizza (8 Eu). We booked with last minute.co.uk which at the time was undercutting the ACCOR website rate - we paid GBP 166.56 for our 3 nights. For us it was definitely worth the saving to stay out here - the 53 bus was very frequent and convenient as well as well air-conditioned for the trip into town. If you're on a budget remember that the Prado and the museum with Picasso's Guernica (from 7-9) are free some evenings for the last 2 hours that they're open. On the Tues night we went to the Prado we had to queue for about half an hour after the free time started (6-8 pm) to get in but we still had plenty of time to whizz the kids around the highlights.

Reviews.Title: “when a luggage mixing incident blurred all the good impressions”
Reviews.Author: georgios123
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel although it was far from the city centre. The bus stop was nearby and very handy to use in order to get to plaza sol. The room was a typical novotel room so no surprises here. The breakfast was excellent,tasty and variable. But on the check out day there was a problem that was I think unacceptable. We gave our lugguge to store in the hotel's luggage room and they gave us the number coupon so there would not be a mixing lugguge problem.But unfortunately it did occur a mixing problem!!! The luggages were identical so I didn't understood when they gave me the wrong one. I found out in the airport security check because there were some large liquids inside the stranger's luggage. I called the hotel right away and they offered to send mine and give the other to a taxidriver but we didn't had enough time and it was quite risky to loose our flight. The problem was solved after numerous e-mails and courrier delivery. I was impressed by their will to solve this problem as soon as possible. But of course trere are some questions unanswered. Why didn't they check the number coupons? What would have happened if my id or passport were in the lugguge that was back in the hotel? What would have happened if there were illegal substances in the stranger's luggage such as illegal drugs or weapons ? What would i say to the security check in the airport ? I better not think the answers...

Reviews.Title: “City Break”
Reviews.Author: lomas1991
Reviews.Content: We went for New year for a break, this hotel was ideal! Its situated right near the city centre, so its cheap in a taxi to all the attractions bars etc. Get the hotel to ring you a taxi as its very hard to pull them over on the street! Staff were very friendly and tried their best to speak English as much as they could! (Although this was very limited) This hotel was mainly Spainish people so translation was a struggle at times. Do you're research before you go with regards to attractions! Bedrooms where clean and modern. Everything you needed, beds were also comfy which is always a bonus! The restraunt offered a great menu and the food didn't dissapoint! There is an outside pool which looked lovely but it was too chilly for a dip in december! My only comment was the bar was shut far earlier than what was stated in the information package! Anyone thinking about going to Madrid for new year, I would advise to do it! Madrid is a vibrant place to be, new years eve everyone gathers in the square it was a great and memorable night! I would return when visiting Madrid again, great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Mat S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here June 2012 for business trip (didn't get to see much of Madrid sadly). Very clean hotel, friendly staff. Room was good. Breakfast was excellent - hot food, croissants, fresh bread, hot drinks, fresh juices, brownies (!!), fruit, luxury jams, yogurts, etc - very good quality ingredients and buffet style. Room and breakfast came to less than 80 pounds per night, which was excellent value for money. Free wifi as well as free public computers with good Internet access. Swimming pool is good on a hot day. Room was very quiet and had air con. 10-15 minutes from airport, about 20 Euros in a taxi. Not sure about location in terms of Madrid, but there are a couple of parks close by, where kids and adults can play (playgrounds, tennis courts, football areas, etc), as well as a bull fighting stadium short walk - you might not approve of the 'sport' but the stadium as a building is quite magnificent and worth a look/photo. I have stayed in hotels more expensive than this in London and they don't come anywhere near it in terms of value for money and facilities. Would definitely recommend this hotel and come back here if/when I visit Madrid again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent breakfast, comfortable rooms, free access to computer”
Reviews.Author: Cana1Toronto
Reviews.Content: The rooms were not what I would call wow, but were decent, clean, modern chic. The beds were comfortable. The hotel had a bar, offered an excellent breakfast, lots of variety and was of very good quality, consisting of Spanish omlettes, scrambled eggs, chorizo sausages, ham, sliced meats, cheeses, baked tomato, pancakes, cereals - granola, all sorts of yoghurts from natural to flavored, fresh and dried fruits, nuts. croiscents, bread, a good variety of juices, coffees, teas, sauces, honey, maple syrup. A great way to start the day. You could take the 53 bus to get into the heart of town or take the subway. While the bus didn't require transfers, we prefered the subway as it was fast and very clean. Madrid's subways are the best I've seen. The hotel concierge was helpful and there are two computers available to the hotel guests for free - and there is a time limit on them. There is a pool, entertainment area, lots of ammenities. The price for the hotel was very good and there were lots of interesting places in the immediate area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice central hotel”
Reviews.Author: VIndorf
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, large common areas, near the city by public transport or taxi, the rooms are fine

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel,But evening meals need improving”
Reviews.Author: explorerEastAnglia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with Riviera travel Nice hotel very clean, good sized bedrooms with modern shower room.All rooms had kettles!!.The breakfasts were first class with masses of choice. The evening meals were buffet style and were very poor in quality and selection especially the main course. A long way to the centre of Madrid but a good bus service which takes about 40 mins.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but food needs improving!”
Reviews.Author: kentraveller97
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights as part of Riviera travel tour.Location not ideal as it took us 40 mins to get to Sol by bus.Rather bland hotel used by business people.Rooms pleasant and staff helpful. Downside was the food =little variety /choice and often served barely warm!No vegetarian option. Local supermarket was useful for provisions=5 mins away.Rather characterless area =huge blocks of flats and no parks. Staff were always friendly but would not recommend a long stay here=try somewhere closer in to centre.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and extremely helpful and kind staff”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I stayed in the hotel, with the first time in 2007. It is highly impressive that all staff have been so helpful and pleasant. Perhaps the best one I have ever experienced with many hotels. The only downside is that the room is a bit small for 3 adults and 1 child. In particular, the sofa bed for 1 adult and 1 child is rather uncomfortable. The reason we did not choose two rooms is because my parents speaks neither Spanish nor English and I also need them to help take care of my child. It would be better for the hotel to think of such a demand of this group of guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: harrall
Reviews.Content: We spend three nights here during Easter in April 2012. We had a very good experience with this hotel. First: The value for families is almost unbeatable in Madrid. I spent a lot of time looking for family rooms at Madrid Hotels and would have preferred to stay in the city center itself but came up with nothing inside a decent price range. Novotel has by far the best price for a family room. Second: The hotel itself is actually very good. Friendly service, even when our safe broke down and needed to be drilled up on a Sunday morning. Our room was clean and fresh. The breakfast was splendid. (We did not use the restaurant for dinner due to the reviews here at Tripadvicor. Stay away from the restaurant across the street as well, but go 1 km up the street to El Pitaco which is excellent). Check in and check out was no problem. And the Novotel website is easy-to-use. Third: The location is not bad. The 53 bus stop is 75 meter from the Hotel entrance. The bus is frequent and will take you to Plaza del Sol in about 15 minutes. And there is a Metro station (Parque de las Avenidas) across the highway bridge about 600 meter away. It's an easy walk. I can recommend this hotel to anyone but especially families.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: PiperToronto
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a trip to Spain and stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. It was overall, a good hotel..price was fantastic (52 Euros per night including taxes due to a corporate rate), free wi-fi, clean and comfortable rooms and about a 10 min walk to the nearest metro station. Came with the usual amenities including a safe, kettle with tea and coffee, tv, etc. It is a bit out of the way and far from the main sights of Madrid but as other reviewers have mentioned, just hop on the 53 bus located right by hotel for an easy ride into the city centre - goes right to Sol and from there, you can walk to Plaza Mayor, Royal Palace, Gran Via, etc. Or you can get off near Banco de Espana and walk down to Prado Museum. I preferred doing this rather than taking the metro as you can just relax and enjoy the scenary and you don't have to transfer. Buses came frequency except on Sundays, it took around 20 mins. Free wi-fi is also offered on the bus! The room itself was clean enough although the bathroom was looking a bit tired...there were some cracks in the walls but I've seen far worst so it's only a minor complaint. The wi-fi connection was not very good though, the signal kept on dropping...if you can get on at all! I was on the 3rd floor so I was surprised..normally, I would expect the signal strength to be stronger on a lower floor as opposed to a room on a higher floor. As for the restaurant, I ate there for dinner on my last night as I had a very early morning check-out and didn't feel like going outside for dinner. It wasn't bad...the fixed price menu for 16 Euros was good value - you get 3 courses and the food was very filling! All in all, it was a good hotel, for that price, it can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Convenience, Quality and Price”
Reviews.Author: hwakil
Reviews.Content: I was thinking initially of renting an apartment but changed my mind since we were staying only for 4 nights, so we opted for Novotel is usually our perfect choice for city stays. Check-in was swift (3 minutes) so was my check-out. The room was clean and modern, furniture were comfortable (bed and kids sofa), we really had good nights sleep after long Madrid days. There is a bus station(no. 53) just in front of the hotel which takes you to the city centre (Station Sol) or to any other station where you change to the Metro. This was very convenient. We tried the restaurant once in our last night. The food and service were very good generally, I had only a small comment on my burger which was a bit oily, but my wife's sirloin was great. Overall I was disappointed chosing Novotel over an apartment stay, and I recommend it for travellers to Madrid who are looking for convenience and quality of Hotel stay with good price.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: GrumpyOldham
Reviews.Content: This hotel, although not in the city, is well served by a frequent,cheap bus service which stops outside the door. I found it rather characterless and on the whole prefer family-run hotels, but it provided all you would want. The pool was very pleasant to relax in and sit by after a hard day's sightseeing. Food was good on the whole, though I disliked being coralled in the darkest part of the restaurant as we were part of a tour party and not business customers who seemed to get better service. Rooms were comfortable, but when we opened the window the staff came in and locked it.Despite asking at reception for it to be reopened, no-one appeared. Tip - Take a teaspoon to the room to insert into the lock to turn it!

Reviews.Title: “Stolen handbag in hotel lobby”
Reviews.Author: LayHoon
Reviews.Content: Utterly disappointed that hangbag was stolen in hotel lobby ;( upon arrival. No action done by Hotel although video camera shown indeed bag was stolen.

Reviews.Title: “My choice in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: TravelerBR
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel every year since 2008, so my review can't be biased by an only stay. They always provide a decent service, good and clean rooms - not very large to be honest, but I'm most by myself. Location is good to me, not far from downtown. The part I most like is the restaurant, good cost/benefit for meals and best breakfast I have during the year - I should say I travel and stay in hotels in 5 different countries all year round, but that's is top notch - , varieties of good bread, natural orange juice, and more - all fresh. The hotel has one of the best relation cost benefit for what they charge, would definetely recommend to anyone traveling to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Typical average chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: randomtraveller80
Reviews.Content: Good size room and bathroom. Free wifi in rooms. A full buffet breakfast was just under €15 per person. Choices weren't great. There is parking in the hotel for a fee - €12 per night. Location is ok - there is a cafe / tapas bar just across the road. Food there isn't great but one could get some breakfast for under €5. There are a couple of supermarkets which are within walking distance - approximately 10 to 15 mins walk. It is about 15 to 20 mins drive to the airport (depending on traffic). There is a public bus every 10 to 15 mins to the city centre which would take about 20 to 30 mins, again depending on traffic. Overall, I would say it's a good hotel for business travellers and wouldn't recommend it for a romantic or a family weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “Seems far away but in fact is close”
Reviews.Author: Leonardo_Sadcovitz
Reviews.Content: Once you find out the bus 53 stop, you are just a few minutes from downtown. Hotel has very nice rooms with free internet, nice breakfast and very educated employees. We stayed for the new year´s eve dinner and it was very pleasent. If you want to take taxis, they are quiet cheap, no matter where you go.

Reviews.Title: “Pass but needs improvement.”
Reviews.Author: Caico23
Reviews.Content: Curtain on shower boxes are clearly a old and unefficient system but they still use it. After every shower the bathroom was flooded. Besides that the localization is good, room space is enough. Breakfast is too expensive. We have complained about the shower problem to the reception desk on the morning shift and the people told us to talk to the night shift staff after coming back from the rides to know the status of our complaint. We did it but the people from the night shift didn't know anything about it.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location and modern”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is both handy for the airport and central Madrid, Taxis are the best way to move around or car hire if on an extended stay. The Hotel is of high quality in all areas, and the staff are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is good and varied.The bar is well stocked but expect to pay more than the local bars. Would use again on my next visit. DJC.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very friendly and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: PandaPolly
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. It was clean, the staff were very helpful and friendly. It has a lovely outside pool and is very close to both the bus stop and tube station for easy transport into Madrid centre. I do not understand how people can complain about it's location, it does not claim to be in the main centre. There is a great cafe/bar opposite the hotel for food and drinks and a large supermarket around the corner but not much more within walking distance. This is an observation not a complaint. Taxi into town was €15. A great experience, we cannot wait to return. Thank you Novotel!!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located being midway from the city to the Barjas airport. Bus stop for local bus to and from city centre is at the end of hotel driveway. Reception staff were friendly and helpful with directions,checkin and checkout etc. Rooms were clean and modern,bar and restaurant were very good and staff excellent. Typical high standard ,comfortable and well appointed Novotel hotel

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We went for a lads weekend away and chose this hotel as it was a bargin. The only bad point i had for this hotel was its location, although it is close to the city centre we spent a lot of money on cabs to and throw. The staff are very friendly and polite, the rooms are very clean and nice, and the food from the bar was very good. would definately suggest this hotel for a cheap weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “A chain hotel, but very good!”
Reviews.Author: gandg100
Reviews.Content: The Novotel is a modern hotel which some would say makes it a bit characterless, but inside it's been decorated with a Spanish 'modern art like' theme. Buffet breakfast and evening meals were very good. Coffee in the morning was a bit 'hit and miss', but staff were always very helpful. It's away from the city centre so you need to use the (excellent) bus services to visit the main cultural sites.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie C
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 night stay at this hotel and all 4 of us (me, my husband, and my two sons aged 9 and 14} thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel and cant recommend it enough. The room was adequate, all of us had good nights sleep in comfy beds, a lovely bathroom and the coffee and tea making facilities were very handy!! We found that apart from one night (when we went to a Real Madrid football match) we ate in the restaurant and sat in the lounge/lobby and played cards, had drinks from the bar and my two sons enjoyed making use of the free xbox which went down very well. Caught the number 53 bus just outside hotel in to Madrid centre most days, very useful, taxi from aiport on arrival was 15 minutes, all the staff were really friendly and always smiling. Beds made every day and clean towells always. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Very good option for a family of four”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good service. The staff were very friendly. Quiet place. Near a bus stop, and 5 minute walk from the Metro. The room was nice and comfortable for families with two children. The breakfast is expensive unless you have a promotinal price with the breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “good for Madrid sights”
Reviews.Author: Pam-Ruislip
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel for four nights as part of a tour and our initial hesitations about not being in the centre of Madrid were completely wiped away when we discovered the ease of getting into Madrid. The number 53 bus stops right outside the hotel and for 1 euro 50 cents takes you into the Centre, past some of the wonderful sights of Madrid. Some of our group used the Metro which is also near the hotel and also said how easy it was to use. The rooms are large, clean and comfortable, the food varied and good - what more can you need? There are comfortable lounge areas to sit, relax, read or have a drink. The small terrace overlooking the pool was well used. The staff are brilliant and very helpful - all we came in contact with understood English and our appalling attempts at Spanish! We really enjoyed our time at the Novotel and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, only convenient if you need to be near here”
Reviews.Author: Chris W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a work trip, my office is just down the road so ideal location. Would not really be suitable if you wanted to be near the city and do some sightseeing - was about 10 stops from the best bits of Madrid The staff are extremely friendly and welcoming, happily organised taxis and laundry for me. Room included free Wifi, which was good. Room itself was a bit dated, airconditioning didn't really do a lot, and the bed was a bit creaky, but it did the job. After a night out in Madrid you don't care what the bed's like!! Ordered room service one night and the burger was raw in the middle, and the chips cold. That was the only meal I had. And although I booked a room only rate and ate breakfast at work, they added daily breakfast to my bill and I had to point it out to them at check out. Seemed to be a genuine error though. Decent place if you need to be in this area...

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel with Easy Bus/Metro Access to City Center”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the morning after a long flight. The hotel desk clerk was very gracious and without hesitation found us a room to check in immediately, ensuring a great start to a wonderful stay in Spain. Like many Novotels we have stayed in, this one had large, comfortable rooms decorated in that nouveaux 50's/60's modern look. The bed was relatively new and very comfortable. The downstairs lobby was chic and inviting, and included a very nice restaurant, the Claravia. Nice pool. In short, if you want quaint, old buildings in an old part of town, this hotel (and most Novotels) just won't be your cup of tea. But if you like a large comfortable "business-style" room in a middle class neighborhood, it's a great place to stay with easy access by bus or metro to the city center. If you can find a rate with breakfast included, go for it --- the buffets are loaded with enough fresh pastry, ham, fresh-squeezed orange juice, cereal, etc. to last easily into the mid-afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Outside the Action of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca A
Reviews.Content: Nice modern hotel with standard features expected. The room was comfortable for the two of us without stepping all over each other. Location is outside the city center so expect to take a 30minute bus ride or 20minute metro into the city to explore the Madrid you traveled for. The hotel restaurant and room service are okay but there aren't a ton of restaurant options around the hotel to choose from so plan accordingly. The best thing about the hotel was the staff who could speak many languages and help you in anyway possible.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid Aug 2011”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to stay in this lovely hotel for 2 nights, but unfortunately my bag was stolen on the Metro on our first evening & we had to leave a night early. We cannot thank Mr Jose Luis Serrano on the Front Desk enough for all the help he gave us, including contacting the police for us, booking a taxi to take us to the station and changing us to another hotel for a second night. We will have to return another time to enjoy more of this lovely hotel. Pool area is particularly good!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; not downtown but easily accessible”
Reviews.Author: toygim
Reviews.Content: Stayed with hubby and 3 kids in 2 separate rooms. They were spacious with queen size beds and a pull out sofa bed. Everything worked fine but as with it seems all European hotels, water leaks onto the floor from the shower/tub because of the short side panel. Is there a problem with having a plain old shower curtain? The bed is probably the most comfortable bed I've slept in at a European hotel. Very firm but well-cushioned. The pool was a definite plus in the hot weather but it is unheated and a bit chilly. Not thrilled with evening dinner at the restaurant. Food was just ok and service seemed to be confused and was very slow. Appetizers and main courses were served at the same times and then another main course took another 10 minutes to arrive and it wasn't even hot. Don't like tepid steak! Breakfast though was very good with lots of choice and the kids are free; a huge plus! The fresh orange juice was fantastic! We actually had a hotel booked near Opera and cancelled it because we felt the 20-25 min. bus ride was worth the savings. The Novotel ended up being less than half the price of the other one. There is a bus stop just across the street from the Novotel with the #53 bus going to Puerta del Sol every 10-15 mins.; 20-25 mins on off hours. This also lets you take in the sights that you might not have seen by staying downtown. We actually saw Plaza del Toros (Las Ventas), Palacio de Comunicaciones, Biblioteca Nacional and other places that we would not have seen had we not been on the bus. We also arrived here by taking the Metro from the airport. You go to T2, hop on, switch a couple of lines and you're there! Takes around 35-40 mins. and another 10 min. walk to the hotel or had we known when we arrived, we could have taken the # 53 bus which is just 2 stops away from the hotel. The transit system is fantastic. Metro and buses are new, clean and very efficient. Very easy to get around. With the money we saved, we took in a flamenco and dinner show at Café de Chinitas (very good show!) and a bullfight at Las Ventas. Dinner at the Café was ridiculously overpriced but you can also just take it the show itself. I'd absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone. It's not downtown, but the savings are well worth it and it is on par with any other 4* hotel we've been at, or even better.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely spacious rooms great service”
Reviews.Author: Tunn-1
Reviews.Content: Standard Room is spacious with King bed, en suite bath or shower, sofa, work area, TV with pay movies and internet access, broadband connection, hair dryer, safe and tea/coffee. Great buffet breakfast. It was a bit far out from the city centre so we had dinner in house and then hired a movie.Great Dinner~! . It's near the metro station and you can easily reach the heart area of Madrid by train but we were on a TT tour so didnt need to use it.

Reviews.Title: “City Break”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A convenient and good quality hotel. Rooms are well furnished and comfortable. Restaurant good although limited choice if you stay for more than a couple of nights. Friendly and helpful staff. Have stayed here now 5 or 6 times which speaks for itself.

Reviews.Title: “a little far but good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: transportation from airport was easy. I bought madrid transport card and we arrive hotel in half an hour with metro (card works fine I recommend to everyone, buy online and collect at airport). three lines but fast and reliable. after accomodation you can go to sol with single bus in 20 minutes. hotel is clean and quiet. swimming pool is tiny one and generally crowded, forget about swimming but, good for sunbathing. I think this hotel is value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Fantastic value money. We had two kids with us, 10 and 8 who shared a pull out sofa..the room itself was very clean if a little small. Shower was also a bit weak but really the hotel was spot on for our 2 night visit. The staff could not have been more helpful throughout our visit. Breakfast for a family of 4 I thought was very good value..the night time food was expensive but the children's menu was very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I've been in many novotels around Europe, they all look the same, good standards in terms of service, room, food, equipment and price. The Novotel Puente de la Paz is far way from the city center (around 30mn bus 53 to reach puerta del sol) but is very nice. Great service and nice pool area !

Reviews.Title: “Good facilities...but nothing around the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice - staff extremely helpful and friendly. Breakfast was great. Hotel advertises itself as family friendly, but has very limited facilities for young children. Restaurant does not offer a child friendly menu. Also, there are limited food options around the hotel, given its location. But overall, the hotel itself was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good old Novotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The "Puente de la Paz" Novotel is located pretty far from the city center, which can be reached by bus (no change) or metro (at least 2 changes). The bus stop is right next to the hotel, while the metro station is about 10 minutes by foot. The nearest place of interest is the "Las Ventas" Plaza de Toros, which can easily be reached after a nice 20 minutes walk. The neighborhood seemed crappy when we first arrive there, but in the end we had no trouble at all walking there by night. The staff pointed out some restaurants and a supermarket that can be reached by walking for 5 minutes. From the beginning until the end of our stay, the staff was extremely nice and polite. This is what you can expect when staying in a 4* hotel. They made themselves available, and helped us with directions and places of interest. The room was old, but furbished in a very nice way which made it look vintage. We had some problems with the electric blinds, but didn't complaint about it because we managed to make them approximately work in the end. We even had a kettle inside the room. The air con was working very well, but from time to time it wasn't enough to make the room cool enough. The bathroom was awesome, you could spend hours taking a shower. On our last night we experienced a lot of noise from the other rooms, but the hotel is not responsible for other tourists shouting in German. We didn't have breakfast there, so we can't rate it. In the end, this is an old 4* hotel which was very good !

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Spain”
Reviews.Author: djcann
Reviews.Content: Madrid was our first stop on our honeymoon in Spain. We were pleasantly surprised by our room at the Novotel Madrid Puente de la Paz. The staff spoke english, which was very helpful for us, they were very friendly and assisted us in finding the proper means of transportation throughout the city. The bus that shoots downtown is easy and inexpensive. I highly suggest this hotel. Read the story of our honeymoon at: http://wp.me/p1E4nh-a0

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good choice for a tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: WaltR
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights as part of a tour around the ancient cities of central Spain. The No 53 bus is just across the road with a good service into Puerto del Sol and the Metro is only about 10 minutes walk away so location is pretty good. Rooms are a good size and the bathroom was too although water pressure could have been better and it would have been nice to have had a bath as well as a shower. It was very hot in Madrid on our visit so we kept the a/c on rather than open the window and on that score it would have been nice to be able to open it ourselves rather than having to get a member of staff to do it. Good choice of food at breakfast and dinner but can be very busy and things can run out although staff usually replenish things fairly quickly. Prices in the bar seemed a bit steep. Free wifi in the lobby a bounus.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: marbles27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel for 2 nights and can't fault this hotel. It is clean, convenient for the metro, the staff are friendly and helpful (and speak English), and the breakfast (which was included in the price through Hotels.com) is excellent and includes cereals, fruit, hams meats rolls and cheeses, egg bacon sausage tomato tortilla, as well as a great selection of pastries and sweets! The Metro system in Madrid is fantastic, so easy to navigate your way around and not a piece of litter anywhere! Line 8 takes you into the city centre. You need to make a couple of changes to get onto line 7 to take you to the Parque de la Avenidas stop and then take the pares exit (right). At the top of the steps turn round and follow the road until you reach the Santander bank, turn right here and you will see the Novotel on the left hand side over the motorway bridge. To escape the hustle and bustle of Madrid for a while visit the Parque del Retiro . its a great place to catch your breath! Also well worth a visit are the Santiago Bernabeu Football Stadium and the Reina Sofia Art Gallery where you can see works by Picasso and Dali. A lot of places are not English speaking so our tip would be to learn a few basics before you go.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, service and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ibby2
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. We paid 46 euro for a room for a family of 4. The Reception staff were fantastic, they attended to our requests immediately and were always very helpful. The room is modern and comfortable. The 53 bus stop is outside the hotel and takes you to the Centre of Madrid for 1 euro.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: anocas91
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very good, clean and calm, and we would have totally enjoyed our time if it weren't for the stealing of one of our best jackets from our own room. We contacted the reception but they didn't do anything and no one took responsability. Besides that, they didn't even take into consideration this whole situation in the final price.

Reviews.Title: “Good value business hotel but no ambience”
Reviews.Author: leech_family
Reviews.Content: This hotel represents fair value for money - around €80 a night - but is beginning to look a little tired around the edges. I stay here because it is very handy for work and also a short taxi ride to the airport. It costs around €10 to get into down-town Madrid by taxi and therefore is not too bad an option for tourists, especially as it features a swimming pool for hot summer days. There is also a metro stop within walking distance. I have recently discovered a good bar near the hotel entrance which is fun for a beer and some tapas with the locals.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Madrid Puente de la Paz, A convenient stop”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had previously stayed at this Novotel. It is conveniently located near the M30 and Metro stations to do sightseeing in Madrid. You can take a walk in the neighborhood of the hotel and find stores and restaurants amidst private residences and some gardens that make for an atmosphere that belies the proximity of the noisy and busy M30. The hotel is quiet well insulated and its restaurant, bar and cafeteria are pleasant. The hotel is well located to access the road to the Barajas airport. All of these features make it good for a stop in and out of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, modern and good service throughout”
Reviews.Author: SiTaylor
Reviews.Content: I can thoroughly recommend a stay at this hotel. Although slightly outside the really centre of Madrid, it's a great location for business and you can easily access the metro and taxi's of the city to get around. The service at the hotel is everything you expect from Novotel, with good quality food served at breakfast and spacious, clean and modern bedrooms. Very friendly staff ensure you feel welcome and nothing was too much trouble. Will certainly stay at this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “One night in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Goscha
Reviews.Content: Nice place! Hotel is located near the airport. The room was clean and comfortable. The double room has even a sofa in addition to a large double bed. There was a computer and television - two in one. It needs some time to understand how it all works. From toiletries we did not find body lotion, which is usually in hotels such class.

Reviews.Title: “Far from the centre”
Reviews.Author: javp
Reviews.Content: This is an average Novotel unit, not the best, but also not the worst. The rooms are clean and according to the expect in a Novotel. The restaurant has a limited choice and the food is far from being appelative, althoug eatable. The service is, in general, the same you can find allover Spain, professional but somehow cold. Good and large underground parking, which you should pay directly at the reception desk and not in the automatic machine (much more expensive, I don't know why). The main problem of this hotel is its distance to the city centre or the major attractions. Located on a residencial neighborhood, you must take the "metro" to everywhere, and the nearest station is a 10-15 minute walking from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay for good price”
Reviews.Author: comnen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at that hotel in January 2011. Decided to get to the hotel from the airport on our own, by metro. It proved to be very quick and easy, though it was about 10-11p.m. The room was booked via promotion (-50%), and we really enjoyed our stay for such a resonable price. The only problem we faced was the usage of a TV in a room. It can be both TV and computer, but keyboard did not work well.

Reviews.Title: “Muy buena!”
Reviews.Author: Jezster
Reviews.Content: Given some earlier reviews, I was slightly concerned as to what I'd find, but I shouldn't have worried, my room on the first floor was excellent: modern furnishings, clean, warm and comfortable. The room also had a flat screen LCD TV, FREE wi-fi, a safe, a kettle, a typical minibar and electronic window blinds. It had a spotless and stylish bathroom, with a great shower that had a large head the size of a table-tennis bat! Also, the sound from the TV was piped in, which is always a nice touch. The location is OK, about a ten minute walk from Parque de las Avenidas station on Line 7 of Madrid's comprehensive, yet easily-navigable and good value Metro network. The area felt perfectly safe to me. I think the hotel is very much targetted towards the businessman/woman as evidenced by the free shuttle van that doesn't go into town as you might expect, instead it goes to various big companies in the area. But for this reason, you might get a good rate at weekends as I did. All in all, I was extremely impressed, and would be more than happy to stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyCarmen
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a no frills hotel. But for me the most important things are cleanliness and service. And this hotel had both. When we booked our hotel/air package with Gate 1, we knew it was a budget package and we were not expecting luxury accomodations. We were pleasantly surprised with this small hotel. Check in went smooth and quickly, the room was clean and the daily breakfast was tasty and pleantiful. There were small issues, like we only recieved two bath towels and two hand towels daily, but, these things aren't deal breakers for me. We did have to take the bus/metro to get to the center of town, but, we already knew that when we booked our trip. For European standards this was a clean, and budget friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Leisure trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was decent. There was a banging noise from a window left open on another floor during the night but the staff took care of it and gave us a discount because of the inconvience.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Decent location, good breakfast spread Not a very friendly staff, lacking in service..probably overgrown

Reviews.Title: “About my stay at Novotel Puente de la Paz in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: As usual with Accor, I found exactly what I expected: promptness, effectiveness, willing to help. Everything went OK. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “My Stay at Novotel Madrid Puente de la Paz.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderfull stay at the hotel. We found the lobby very nice with the art paintings on the walls. The room as usual was very nice. I only have one comment about the hotel not having any Weight Scale. This is very important because we need to weight our luggage before we check it in at the airport. I am a loyal client and will be back again to check in at a Novotel on my next business trip. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Day 1 of a 2 week tour of Spain”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent value - outstanding service delivery for the price. In general, I really like Novotel's child friendly approach, and this one was no exception. Though not located in the heart of the city, a 1 Euro trip on bus no. 53 (bus stop is right outside hotel) will get you to SOL and Gran Via, the main shopping and tourist district in under 20 minutes. We arrived 10 AM and they kindly allowed us an early check in. Very hospitable and professional in all aspects of their approach to customers. Free internet downstairs on great big Macs + free print facility too.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE FOOD”
Reviews.Author: Flo413
Reviews.Content: We travelled with Riviera Tours. The room & bed were comfortable but the food was awful. It may be that, being in a tour group, we were fed in a separate room with a buffet. The' hot ' food was just tepid each night (we were there 4 nights) & not much choice. I think health inspectors in the UK would have certainly prevented them from serving food like that. Tour groups are accommodated on certain floors & these do need updating. Some members of our group had requested a 1st floor room & they said that compared to the rest of the group it was luxury. There is no coffee provided in the tour group bedrooms. The pool was closed for the winter months. Beware that drinks bought in the hotel are very expensive. It costs more for a glass of wine or spirit than it would to buy a whole bottle in the 2 supermarkets up the road. It is a long way, on the bus, to Madrid but reasonably priced. The trouble with Riviera was that the tour was badly planned & people were left on their own to get around. It seems to be done on the cheap, although they charge as much as other groups that are far more attentive. We had to struggle to pack our own cases into the coach & out & no help to the rooms. Very difficult for a lot of elderly people. The last day we had to be out of the rooms by 11am & had to wait over 7 hours until we were taken to the airport. I would suggest looking for alternatives. Also it was rather noisy as they had covered a hole in the driveway with a metal sheet & everytime a vehicle drove over it , it sounded like thunder & we were on a high floor!

Reviews.Title: “Do not eat dinner in the restaurante as it is truly awful.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was excellent. The secure garage was very good. The breakfast buffet was very poor. Mango juice was off. Teapot spout was cracked. Hot food not at all appetising. Dinner was absolutely awful. I had the chicked dish which looked a real mess and was dreadful. I can only imagine the chef had the night off as no professional chef could allow such a disgusting dish of food to leave their kitchen. It was without doubt the very worst food of our 14 day tour. I did complain and was given a discount. I would recommend the hotel but guests should seek food elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good Place to stay, although didnt had much for the vegetarians to eat, but the staff was very good and supportive to suggest you and make stuff which we can eat.... Good Rooms and hotel conveniently placed to be easily connected to city and airport...

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Madrid Puenta de la Paz”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel with reasonable location. Use the hotel website to check if location is suitable. Rooms adequate with tea / coffee making and WiFi included in the rate.Only English language channels are news. Bathroom OK, but no rooms with bath, only shower. Restaurant reasonable, and breakfast good with cooked items topped up continually. For dinner there is a better local Spanish restaurant across the road. 100 metres away to small shops selling water, wine etc.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: unbelievable99
Reviews.Content: I was staying there for 2 nights. When we wanted directions to the city, the staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were comfortable and a decent breakfast. Just a bit out of the way in the central business district. Free WIFI which was great cos I brought my ipad along. They even had 2 iMacs in the lobby area for internet usage.

Reviews.Title: “A bit tired, now entering renovation...”
Reviews.Author: mrtourne
Reviews.Content: Just finished two back-to-back stays at this hotel, which I had never stayed at - but since my usual business hotel ( the Confortel Atrium, a few blocks away) was sold out for the second week I decided to give it a shot. Overall, for a business hotel I still prefer the Confortel (which despite some flakiness with the wi-fi, is a superior hotel throughout, in no small part since it's newer and in better shape). My main gripe with this hotel is basically the worn-out state that it's in. However, I did see on my second week a big sign in the lobby announcing renovations so maybe that will help. Not sure how long the renovations will be going for and whether that will create some discomfort during construction... Some pros and cons: Pros: - Service is very good, especially the front desk staff. I had no issue storing a bag for the weekend and every time I called or stopped by I got prompt and efficient service. Definite plus. - The free Wi-fi was reliable and fast. This is usually a problem for many hotels in Spain, where their connections become unusable around peak times. I didn't notice many slowdowns at the Novotel, and overall it was very usable. - Individual AC control seems to work very well (in many hotels in Spain you stop having AC the moment winter comes in, and considering the Novotel's windows do not open this is a good thing) - Close to public transportation. Cons: - Smokiness - the moment you walk in the door, especially in the evenings, you get hit by the smell of stale smoke from the bar. This should become better in a couple of months (once the new law banning smoking in enclosed public spaces goes into effect in January) but for now it's seriously off-putting. Some of the stale smell also persists in the rooms, including the two I stayed at, where you can see they used to be smoking and now are not (or maybe people smoked in them nonetheless). Hopefully the renovation will help freshen up the atmosphere. - Tired and dated furniture in the rooms, worn carpets and the like. it really seems to be a problem for the Novotels (I had the same issue in Paris). - Fairly small room service menu, and really high charges for anything in the mini-fridge (4 Euros each, regardless of the item). - Not a lot of food options in the area - other than a few restaurants around Arturo Soria - No gym: there's a swimming pool but no place to work out. - Large number of tour groups staying here, which makes it very busy at all times. Waiting for elevators in the morning can be taxing, and there's not a quiet place in the lobby to sit down and relax... So, all in all, I probably wouldn't repeat as long as the Confortel is available, or even the NH Parque Avenidas (which is on the other side of the highway and is therefore more accessible to transport and walking into the city center).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bjones21
Reviews.Content: Arrived late friday night, the hotel is in a residentail area, and set back from madrids city centre however reception staff were very welcoming. Our room was equipped with a double bed, and a pull out double couch bed. Television, computer desk and chair, mini bar, long mirror, built in wardrobes, bathrooms are quite average in size, clean, modern, the mirrors have a cool tecnique, no matter how steamy the room is the centre of the mirror doesnt steam up :) . Internet in the room was brilliant. There was no noise from other guests, couldn hear a thing outside the room, Had a great nights sleep both nights, bed was really comfy. The hotel itself is immaculately clean, the breakfast is the best ive ever had in a spanish hotel. Everything imagineable, Cereal, different fruits, fruit juices, toast, sausage, bacon, eggs, croissants, muffins, coffee, tea, nesquik hot choc and much more. The hotel did have a pool, there didnt seem to be enough sun loungers for the size of the hotel. but then again you are in Madrid! Dont stay in your hotel, go and explore!! Reception staff were really helpful, nothing was to much bother for them, the rail station is about 10 minutes walk from the hotel. theres a bustops literally to the left of the hotel which takes around 35-40 mins to get into the centre of madid. the train is much faster, If you are in madrid for a couple of days definately opt for the 1,2,3,4 etc day passes, i think for a 2 day pass it was only something like 9 euros, an you can hop on an off buses and trains. We didnt have evening meals in the hotel, we went to the Hard Rock cafe which was delicious, Gino's on Gran Via, was disgusting and highly priced for the poor quality of food you received. If there was anything i would have to be picky about would be the be the bedroo carpets they looked abit tired and in need of replacing. But that is just me being really picky. Honestly, if you opt to choose this hotel for a vacation, business, you will not be disappointed. I am planning on returning this July with my Fiancé.

Reviews.Title: “Service at Madrid Novotel Puenta de la Paz.”
Reviews.Author: ronduck
Reviews.Content: Does this hotel have the best reception staff in the World? If not, I'd like to know. Apart from being multi-lingual, which is a pre-requisite these days anyway, they went out of their way to be helpful day and night. Nothing was a problem at all. I wouldn't be surprised if Novotel lost at least some of them to one of the more famous hotel chains.

Reviews.Title: “OK'ish but 1 3/4 hour walk from the centre”
Reviews.Author: JeffChambertin
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel by our tour company (the not overly impressive Riviera tours) and would not have chosen anywhere so far away from the centre had we been booking directly. In fairness you can get a bus into town very conveniently, but the underground station is about 10-15 minutes away. I suppose the English equivalent would be to find yourself in a hotel overlooking the A1 at Finchley. We travel a lot and did not think this to be particularly dated or tired, as has been suggested by some reviewers. It is however a bigish, boring commercial hotel suitable for naff coach tours and sales reps. It is in a largely residential area and the receptionist told us that if we wanted bars etc we should go into the city as nearby establishments were for the locals. The room was ok but had a faint residual smell of cigarettes and I found it a little choking. On arrival I was astounded by the ridiculous amount of marketing material placed around the room. It was a bit like walking into a tourist office with a bed in it. The marketing folks at Novotel appear to put the slim hope of a bit of in-selling ahead of client comfort. Our package included free evening meals but after the first night we decided to go elsewhere. On the plus side the hotel had free Wi-Fi and breakfast was quite good by Spanish standards. If you are on a tight budget and can get a good room rate it is not necessarily a bad place to stay: but if you want to enjoy the fabulous night life of Madrid then see if you can get somewhere more central.

Reviews.Title: “Update needed”
Reviews.Author: Sarajon1985
Reviews.Content: Hotel has many good points which can be seen in other reviews. To be improved: Showers grey with use Air conditioning very poor in bedrooms Washbasins not very clean Rooms quite small

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, one-night stay for family of four”
Reviews.Author: Wirral-TTM
Reviews.Content: We had a one-night stay in Madrid and chose the hotel as it could accommodate the four of us in a single room, was very reasonably priced, had a swimming pool and was not *too* far from the city centre. All-in-all, we were very satisfied, and certainly for the price, couldn't really expect more. As other reviewers have noted, the hotel is certainly outside the city centre. However, we took the #53 bus to Plaza del Sol (centre) from just in front of the hotel, and this actually gave us a good view of Madrid, passing the main bullring, Calle de Alcalá, Goya, Plaza de Colón and Paseo de Recoletos before reaching the heart of old Madid. The bus was clean and seemed perfectly safe, so we had no worries about using it. The reception staff were pleasant, rather than overtly friendly. The single stewardess at the bar perhaps needed an extra pair of hands, and as such, she was looking very hassled and a bit terse. The room was clean and comfortable, and the WiFi worked fine. Again, the hotel pool was more than adequate, without being anything spectacular. Would just suggest the hotel install a spin dryer in the pool changing rooms so that swimwear can be dry before it has to be packed. In summary, the hotel was very good value for money, we would recommend to friends in a similar situation, and would certainly consider visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarah1402
Reviews.Content: The hotel have great reception staff, always friendly & helpful. The staff in the bar were always friendly & helpful too. The rooms were a good size with a clean bathroom. The food we had at the hotel was always served quickly & tasted okay. There was 2 computers available in the lobby for guests to use as well as free WIFI access. The only disappointing aspect was that the pool & pool area were out of bounds when we were there at the end of May. This is because the pool can't be used used before June, which did disappoint my Daughter & her friend. You can get the 53 bus into the centre of Madrid for a Euro, it takes around 20-30 minutes, but is a good way to see parts of the city. My Daughter used the Metro with no problems. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: bsomani
Reviews.Content: We went there for a meeting and stayed for 2 days. It was a good and comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Most Enjoyable Sojourn”
Reviews.Author: EPD
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this Novotel as part of a tour of the classical cities of central Spain. The reception & cleaning staff were exceptionally helpful & polite and most spoke very good English. Nothing was too much trouble - especially the reception staff. There are 2 free public computers in reception and free wi-fi throughout the hotel. Our room was spacious and pleasant with a view over Madrid's rooftops and the Islamic Cultural Centre. The air conditioning was very efficient and the bed was comfortable and there was room to move around. The bathroom was spacious but we couldn't quite work out the acoustics as the TV sounded louder from the bathroom than it did in the bedroom! Plenty of room for toiletries & they also provided some shower gel & shampoo and there was a hairdryer. The towels were ok but were a bit hard as if washed too many times. The bath side is VERY high and I was very nervous of slipping The carpet needed a good shampoo. I very much enjoyed the swimming pool as it was 34 degrees while we were there. One major problem was lack of staff at meal times to keep replenishing supplies. The hotel was full and every meal time there were shortages: coffee, cups, serviettes, knives, plates, orange juice - you name it, they ran out. The staff were running round and working really hard to keep it going but there simply were not enough of them to do the job adequately. Many tables had to be left uncleared with piles of dirty pots & leftover food while the waiting staff were fetching more coffee, spoons, etc etc. It was pretty chaotic and a hotel this size should do better. There was a similar problem in the bar with never more than one person behind it and quite often the bartender completely ignored people waiting and walked off to do something else or answer the phone. However, it was a comfortable stay overall and I would stay there again. The 53 bus was easily caught into the city and also easily caught to return. We didn't use the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “A very tired Novotel”
Reviews.Author: Maisonpierre
Reviews.Content: This is a very tired Novotel much in need of a makeover: walls, carpets & bedrooms all well past their sell-by dates. Staff adequate rather than welcoming. Access to carpark designed for cars no larger than Smart cars - not helped by tour buses being parked at the entrance. It should be noted that this hotel is not nearly so conveniently located for Madrid centre as some reviews suggest - a taxi ride to Plaza Mayor costs +/- €14.00. We didn't use the restaurant so can't comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, modern, efficient business/leisure hotel in pretty good location”
Reviews.Author: New_Malden_flier
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights on business and will definitely be returning. If you know Novotel then you know this one - not quite as slick as Novotel in France, but still pretty good - and better than a lot of competing Spanish hotels. Clean, fresh, modern decor. Room OK with no irritations and handy electrical window blinds. Only shower, no bath. Restaurant nothing to write home about - but €16 for three course reasonable dinner including beer and coffee. Good buffet breakfast or quick continental breakfast at the bar. Free wifi. Small complaints: restaurant dinner service very slow on the only night I ate there, and checkout did get overwhelmed again as reported by other reviewers. But small stuff really. Can't understand the comments about location. 5-10min walk to Barrio de Concepcion metro station then 20min into heart of Madrid - for less than one euro. If you have a car then this is place is a good deal - parking for €12 per night, which is very good by Madrid standards - a key reason why I'd return. And the location, with M30 or A2 trunk roads just round the corner is terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised. Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: BettyHarrow
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four who were looking for a hotel which could accommodate four people in one room comfortably. We were pleasantly surprised that the Novotel not only accommodated us comfortably but provide a full sumptious breakfast too. The staff at the reception desk were polite and provided us with a map of the area. We had no surprises with additional expenses when we checked out of the hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel to families who do not want to spend on two rooms or on breakfast. Bus 53 stopped a few minutes from the hotel. The metro was a ten minute walk. The area is safe and we were able to enjoy five full days sightseeing in Madrid. I would recommend a 48 hour Madrid Vision pass to include the culture pass. This allows you to hop on and off the open top buses as well as free entry to several places such as the Prado, Reina Isabel, Bernabeu, Zoo, Torro Plaza etc. It seems expensive to begin with but is a fantastic saving when you count the individual costs.

Reviews.Title: “Descent Value”
Reviews.Author: mikeb777
Reviews.Content: Arrived from USA and took the #204 bus from Terminal T4 to Metro Station. From there took 1 train to a 5min walk to hotel. Arrived at hotel around 1030 and no problem letting us check in early. Room was small, yet modern and clean. Overall room was satisafactory with a shade that makes the room dark from outside light. Noise level was due to internal door closing from housekeeping and other guests, but overall room was quiet from around 10PM till we awoke the next day around 7:00AM. The hotel is situated 3 Metro rides to downtown "SOL" district....Plaza Mayor. Takes about 30 mins including walk from hotel to Metro, but for 1 Euro it's the best form of transportation. Since we only stayed the one day/night, enroute to Tel Aviv we didn't sample any of the hotel ammenities, however it appears they are sparse. Hotel is in a nice location. For the price of 62 Euros/night it appears to be a good price/value compared to other othels in Madrid. Plus free in room Hi Speed interenet is always a plus.

Reviews.Title: “At least the window opened!”
Reviews.Author: paulm999
Reviews.Content: I could see the look on business travellers faces when they realised they were stuck in a far away suberb of Madrid and they would be having to plead with the boss to pay all the taxi fares when they got back. For us it was not an ordeal to catch the 53 bus in to town for 1 Euro and 25 minutes. As seems usual, large groups get treated like second class citizens and demoted to the hot stuffy top floor where at least someone had previously forced the window open. In the dining room we were shunted in to a corner so as not to embarrass the real guests. The swimming pool was OK especially when the lifeguard turned his music down. I was amazed to get free fastish wifi and free printing but I guess that was to make up for no business centre. I guess the breakfast was OKish but ran out incredibly fast and at a pace that the staff seemed unable to equal. In summary, this hotel did nothing to detract from our trip.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, inconvienent location”
Reviews.Author: Huggles_83
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with a great breakfast buffet. Bit far out of the city. attempted to get a bus from the city centre back to the hotel but it was all too much trouble. Got a cab and cost us quite a bit...

Reviews.Title: “Typical Novotel”
Reviews.Author: sanchristobal
Reviews.Content: + rooms are nice, modern and well equiped + breakfast is good + service ok + price ok + outdoor pool available - location is not central (although it says "city centre" on the novotel website), 7-10 min. by foot to next metro station, 30-40 min. total travelling time into the center (you have to change trains once or twice) - location close to the motorway which can also be seen from he rooms. you can hear a distant but relatively constant traffic noise when windows are open. the rooms are equiped with double-double windows which keep the noise out if shut. overall it's ok given the competitive price (we paid about 75 euros for the room incl. breakfast) but the location is a big minus from my perspective. would chose a more centrally located hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Easy peasy lemon squeezy”
Reviews.Author: N-WALES-TRAVELLER
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Madrid following a three night city break that I booked myself. I never book a hotel without first looking on Tripadvisor and to be honest I was unsure but hopeful after reading many of the reviews previously posted. Well, I did not have to worry whatsoever, the hotel is the typical 4 Star business/leisure that you can come to expect in all major European cities. It was very clean, the staff were excellent and nothing was too much effort. If you want to pick holes in anything, you would be hard pushed and if thats what rocks you boat then I suggest you pay the premium rates of the big 5 star brands. This hotel is wonderful and don't ley anyone tell you otherwise. There is also a fantastic pool for those afternoons or mornings whereby you just wish to sit and chill before embarking on the sightseeing in the city. My only problem was,as in most hotels, the bar and food tariff were too expensive. The location is great although not situated in the centre of the city is it so easy to reach by using public transport. Catch a 53 bus from right outside the hotel for 1 euro and 25 minutes later you arrive in the city centre. Alternatively walk for 5 minutes to the nearest Metro station and again for 1 euro you reach the city centre in approximately 10 minutes. One top tip, if you are arriving by air at Madrid Airport, catch the Metro from Terminal 3, a 2 euro fare will get to the nearest Metro station of, Parque de las Avenidas which then intails a 5 minute walk to the hotel. Acting on this tip will save you £££££££'ssssss as a single taxi fare from the airport to the hotel will set you back 35 euros!!!!!!! Great hotel, great public transport, great city. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and great value”
Reviews.Author: Huddsguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business for four nights in May whilst working in the nearby Calle Josef Valcarcel / A2 area where lots of big international businesses have theire Madrid offices. The hotel is only about 10 minutes from Barajas airport by car and is right by the side of the M30 ring road / close to the A2 junction. That said it is in a pleasant residential / commercial area with quite a lot of greenery / public parks nearby & some local shopping. If you need public transport there's a 53 bus right outside which goes right into the city centre and there are Metro stations within about 10 - 15 minutes walk. This Novotel is quite an old property - late 1970s / early 1980s I suspect - but it is undergoing some renovation with rooms on the first four of the eight floors upgraded to the 'new generation' specification which is simple, comfortable and very functional / business friendly. Public areas are clean and bright and the buffet breakfast was ample and of reasonable quality. There's an outdoor pool and terrace although expect some traffic noise if you're sunbathing. The week I stayed saw the arrival of two, free-to-use Macs in the lobby and the introduction of free WIFI throughout the hotel. Best of all was the price. By choosing a pre-pay rate on Accor's website on the day I travelled to Madrid, I got the room for just €79 per night including breakfast. For Madrid, that's a great rate. I'd return on business - but I'd probably not choose the hotel myself for a leisure break as there are better locations in Madrid for the tourist traveller.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Attention”
Reviews.Author: Pataruco
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel in our way to Madrid, about 5 hours earlier, from portugal, great price, wonderful attention, well located, 500 % recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Cool pool, but well outside town”
Reviews.Author: Eurofriends
Reviews.Content: We were part of a Trafalgar European tour group (cost-saver). We stayed at this hotel 2 nights and really spent minimal time in the room/hotel – after all we were in Europe to sightsee! Hotel’s positives - large room - comfortable beds - plasma television, but no English television channels - relatively large bathroom - very clean - modern hotel - large pool, surrounded by sundecks, towels available next to the pool - park nearby to kick a ball around, or to play - bar - dinner was OK, breakfast was nice - wireless internet available, not too expensive (7.50 euro for 24 hours) - restaurant and pharmacy (not English-speaking though – be prepared to mime your requirements) near hotel - easy to get into the city (#53 bus) - staff speak English, which is a welcome find in Spain Hotel’s negatives - the non-smoking room reeked of cigarette smoke, and we were not permitted to change rooms. However staff did immediately come to our room and open the window (special key required) – this didn’t remove the smell completely, but it did help immensely. When we got home, we received an apology letter from management, which was considerate - reception is understaffed and usually crowded

Reviews.Title: “Look For Other Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TatiRiodeJaneiro
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Novotel at 2 pm after a long 11 hours trip and the girl from reception told us there was no room avaiable an that we should have to wait about 1 hour. we tried to argue, we were tired and the two children even more but she said again that there was no room avaiable. My husband started to make a fuss , speaking very loud and the manager was called. Quickly she gave us a room. The room looked very old and was so little , when we put up the bunk bed there was no space to move in. When we went to sleep the room was very hot and we called the recepcionist to complain. She send someone to see the air conditioned but the room still hot. Next night we complained again about the air and she send a person who told us that from october till the end of winter the hotel turned off the air condioned and we had to open the windows. So we did because 4 persons in a tiny hot room was impossible to sleep. Its a pity that a such a chain as Novotel is has such a horrible hotel in madrid . Novotel in Spain..... Never again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's better for bussiness than leisure”
Reviews.Author: Mup3t
Reviews.Content: Over the years, I went to Madrid several times, being the last in April of 2007, where I stayed at Novotel Madrid Puente de la Paz. I went to this hotel because I found a nice rate online (I don't remember the exact value but it was something like €60 per night for a double room). When I arrived I check in without any problems and went to my room which was Novotel standard (a bed, a sofa that we could turn into a bed), a tv, a desk, (...). The bathroom was okay but I had stayed at this hotel previously and I must say that, in my opinion, it was better before they renew it. The breakfast of the hotel is typical continental breakfast with a spanish twist (like tomato in bread). They have a small pool which is nice for a quick swim during the summer (when the temperature can reach 42º/43º). The only real problem of the hotel is that, without a car, you won't go far because the hotel is not central at all.
