Overall, I think that this hotel is a good opinion if one goes to Madrid at work and need a quick and effordless opinion to stay but if one goes for leisure there are better choices to enjoy Madrid for the same price...

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to the helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: SKT17
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights here on my way elsewhere in Spain. If you're someone who doesn't speak good Spanish, you'll always appreciate finding a hotel receptionist who speaks good English. After 15 hours travelling, it was a nice welcome. My room on the 1st floor was quite modern with a good desk/work area, fast internet connection (26 euro per 24 hours which includes all movies) and a new, clean bathroom. Bed was very comfortable, I always appreciate good pillows and a doona instead of blankets. The room service food was nice enough but the menu is quite limited. I discovered there are other options, you just have to ask - they were more than willing to serve a couple of non-menu items for me (soup, fresh fruit, coffee). Now unfortunately during my stay I required the services of a doctor. The front desk arranged an English speaking doctor who arrived within the hour and was very pleasant and helpful. So if it wasn't for my bronchitis I would have explored more but as it was I only spent an hour or two at a nearby shopping area. The El Corte Ingles (C/- Goyd) is a shopping precinct about 8 minutes by taxi (8 euro) and I think a fairly quick bus trip away (1 euro, bus stop out front). I have to say I was disappointed with the stores, whilst the variety was ok, it wasn't a particularly enjoyable experience - too many people, too many disinterested staff.

Reviews.Title: “Full marks for Novotel and its staff”
Reviews.Author: Hotel_traveller32
Reviews.Content: Hello all, I'm a little fussy when it comes to staying at hotels if u read my past reviews, but i do stay in plenty. but the Novotel Madrid Puente De La Paz is............ whats the word....... thats it WOW. From first arriving it looked so beautiful on the outside, then i decided to brave check-in. I arrived at the desk and Was welcomed, checked in without fuss, very polite Receptionist called Sofia. i have this thing where anyone i speak too i give them my name and take their name, i asked Sofia about my room as i like to have a nice one, i was informed that it was totally refurbished 2 years ago, i went to my room 216. walked in and again, WOW. it was beautiful, i dived in to the bathroom cos im sad and love hotel showers, ha ha ha it was a massive walk in shower, huge shower head, all new. checked out the bed.... a massive plus so comfy, plenty of pillows, huge bed, mini-bar all items 3 Euros. everything in the hotel had the vat / Iva already included so there are no nasty surpises at checkout. although they didnt charge me for using the mini bar on checkout. he just ripped it up and said, "its no problem" always a bonus !!! my room looked out onto the dual carriage way but couldnt hear any noise. Down to the hotel bar to checkout the items and service, also to introduce myself. always bodes well as u get extra spirits, i hate rude obnoxious people, i hear them trying to explain their drinks in English by SHOUTING to the bar staff, i dont know how they feel but i feel ashamed. nice drinks at bar, reasonable prices. small beer 3 euros, large beer 5 euros, bacardi and coke 9 euros etc...... small food choice but good value. FRESH nuts olives and pickles served with every drink, never recycled to another customer. It is billed as a family hotel, and behind the bar there is a childrens play area, and i encountered a few screaming children having a good time, i was also lucky enough to encounter a spanish wedding reception, wow nothing like the english ones, everyone was so happy, so well turned out, and hardly drinking, so beautiful. to get to Gran Via by metro, take the metro Parque de la Avenida to Pueblo Nuevo (2 Stops), then change to line 5 for 6 stops i think into Gran Via. takes about 30 mins. there is a bus stop out side hotel also takes 30 mins to Puerto del Sol. if your planning on using the buses metros a few times, u can buy travel cards, i bought a 2 day one for 7.20 euros and it covers you to the airport without paying the 1e supplement. IF u do come to madrid, please stay at the Novotel puente de la paz, im sure you wont be sorry. excellent value hotel not too far from City. Happy Travels. Preston.,

Reviews.Title: “Nice Butcher's Shop Nearby”
Reviews.Author: eurorover
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Hotel Friday lunch for a long weekend Football break with my brother and nephew. Modern hotel located in residential/business district outside Madrid centre. Metro station is five mins. walk and the centre is 10 mins. away. by tube. Rooms very clean and spacious with all mod cons. Excellent facilities, Room TV, Internet, Restaurant, Bar etc. The down side to all this amounted to one thing: the prices. The breakfast 7 euros, 16.50 for the buffet option, and high charges for facilities. Not the place to go on a limited budget. Still, that didn't stop the many businessmen there, hammering their companies' expenses accounts. The small restaurant opposite seemed to do a roaring trade with some of the hotel's clients. The bar staff were a bit of a dead loss, and it was 3 euros for a small beer/cappuccino. However, three cheers for the Reception staff, who were collectively friendly and most helpful to a fault. Despite the location for tourist attractions, we filled our boots at the nearby Butchers shop for meats, salamis, sausages and cheeses for our delight back in the U.K!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: MosesGloucestershire
Reviews.Content: This is a modern hotel with an attractive bar area and an outside patio. It is close to the Motorway (M30) but no problems with noise in the rooms owing to triple glazing. This made the room a little stuffy, but the air con worked quite well. Although not in central Madrid, it was easy to catch public transport into the city centre. Blue and white 53 bus stops right outside the hotel and for 1 euro you can be in the city in about 30 minutes. The food in the hotel was average, but the staff pleasant and helpful in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: RCMM
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay in this hotel through the novotel website and got a city break rate which was really cheap. It was the standard novotel but without the bath tub. We have used 6 other novotel hotels in different countries (italy, belgium, amsterdam, dubai) and this one was the first that didn't have a bath tub. I was also woken up during the middle of the night because of something that smelled like cigarettes, it turned out that the pillows smelled of cigarettes. I specified in our reservation that we wanted a non-smoking room. On the positive side, the people at the reception were all very nice and helpful. The hotel may be outside the city but there's a bus stop a few meters away. Bus 53 takes you direct to puerta del sol (and has a stop at las ventas). The breakfast was good except that there wasn't anyone who readily served us with brewed coffee and hot chocolate (unlike the other novotels). My husband had to find a pot of coffee himself and the hot chocolate was instant that you had to prepare yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, superb breakfast, well communicated”
Reviews.Author: Gordon_and_family
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as it is was a cheap option, near to family in Madrid, so were unsure what to expect. We were very impressed from moment we drove up to front door. The staff are so friendly, and went out of their way to help us. Extra towels, phoning taxis, extra water/coffee/helpings of apple tart at breakfast, etc. For such a reasonable price, we were so well looked after. The breakfast was excellent (try their apple tart if they still have it, it is worth staying there for that alone!). The rooms were clean and large enough for a base to rest. Although remember that in a double room, with an extra 2 single beds we did not have room to spare, but sufficient for our needs. We are a family of 4, and it was superb value. My parents in law spent more for a simple double room, with no breakfast included at another hotel down the road from us. There is a bus stop outside hotel door, or the reception staff will call for a taxi if you prefer. Will most definately stay here again when next in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Very Let Down”
Reviews.Author: Jackiemcmorn
Reviews.Content: Being Novotel, we expected the kind of room we got. The bathroom was nice too. What we didn't expect was the lack of pillows, only 3 for 4 people, the curtain off its track and hanging down, lack of blankets, my daughter used her bedcover only, the fire alarms very bright flashing light going off every few mins, lights not working, putting one of the chair beds up ourselves without instructions after a late arrival - it turned out we were supposed to pull the legs out to make it bed height, my daughter slept on it on the floor - it would have been nicer if the hotel had put the extra beds up for us as we booked 2 adults and 2 children and told them we'd be arriving late. I know maybe's I'm being harsh, but it really annoyed me. The next day, we ate a huge breakfast, the choice was superb and fresh, then headed into the City. When we returned, the bed was raised correctly, the room spotless and the curtain was refixed to the track. We decided as there were no tea making facilities, we'd be decadent and order room service! It was only 8 pm but no one answered, so we waited 10 mins and rang again, hooray it was answered, we asked for 2 hotchocs, but the staff on room service spoke no English and our Spanish wasn't good enough. Not to be put off, we rang the front desk to explain our plight and they put us back to room service, who spoke no English! If they really didn't, shame on the Novotel, a chain of their reputation has no excuse for not making sure at least 1 person on RS spoke it. And if the staff just couldn't be bothered, shame on Novotel. I'm trained in hospitality, I know how hard most work in the industry and how annoying customers can be, but a Hotel of Novotel's reputation, needs to sort out these kind of things. We were going to use the Hotel's restaurant, but the lack of choice was terrible. If we had been there at the 'low' season, I could've understood, but this was Easter weekend and the hotel was really busy with families, Spanish, English and coach tours American and English. The underground parking was an issue too, 18E a day, surely it should've been free or even just a lot cheaper. For what we paid and Novotels reputation, I expected better all round.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, convenient & efficient”
Reviews.Author: Frankly Speaking
Reviews.Content: Very convenient if driving through Madrid . Directions on website were clear and accurate, check in was efficient, room was fine. Restaurant was good and was sensibly priced. All the staff that we came across were very friendly and helpful, We'll stay here again! One gripe - the cost of the onsite underground car park.

Reviews.Title: “A very standard Novotel”
Reviews.Author: imagine71
Reviews.Content: It's a standard Novotel - that meaning the room was clean and appointed in the "standard kind of plastic" Novotel design. I booked the hotel because I was travelling on business and the location was convenient for where I needed to go. If I were to visit Madrid I would definitely stay somewhere else. The neighbourhood is not very nice with a motorway seperating this area from the city on one side and 70s style concrete appartment buildings to the other. There really is nothing interesting directly around the hotel. I could imagine however the the Novotel's outdoor pool woud come in nice in the summer months.

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way location, didn't enjoy staying here”
Reviews.Author: MacKiwi
Reviews.Content: After staying on the other side of Madrid at the start of a trip, I was very disappointed with my stay the Novotel. The location is on the edge of the central part of the city and I didn't feel very comfortable in the area as there are lots of apartment type buildings but no people walking around. There is a bus that takes you to the centre of the city for 1 Euro, I didn't want to walk around the streets to the metro though. The hotel staff weren't helpful and I was pleased to be only staying a short time.

Reviews.Title: “Unfavorable, Business Traveller”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm a business traveller and usually don't care where my company houses me on the road. Just came back from a four city, five hotel, three week campaign throughout Europe. My experience at Novotel was so troubling that I requested to Peronel NOT to book me there again. I'm heading back to Madrid tomorrow (Sat Mar 25) to finish up, but I will be staying at different hotel. The problems are numerous-- charged for breakfast all five days, even though I never had any; charged 70 euros for laundering six pairs of sox, underware and a pair of jeans; cleaning service entering the room after CLEARLY placing the Do Not Disturb placard on the door and informing them not to several times (very frustrating having someone do something afer repeatedly telling them not to); and what's with that shower configuration? Okay... that mad me feel better getting it of my chest.

Reviews.Title: “recommended”
Reviews.Author: guba-7
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Novotel for a long weekend, and enjoyed it. Got off to a bad start, because our cab took us initially to the other Novotel hotel in Madrid! Not to worry - when we got there, the room was clean and spacious. The staff were pleasant and knowledgeable. The hotel's location can be a factor, but we didn't mind. The 53 bus takes you from the hotel to the centre of Madrid for 1 euro; it takes good 20 minutes, but I found the journey enjoyable, as you go past several tourist sites on the way. A taxi back in the evenings cost 10 euros. The bar/lounge was great, and the restaurant was excellent. There is an outdoor swimming pool, but with temperatures near freezing, we decided to give that a miss!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at the Puente de la Paz”
Reviews.Author: hunybuny8
Reviews.Content: My single room at the Novotel Puente de la Paz was nicely sized and the bed was comfortable. The bath was big but the tub was on a platform which made stepping out a little dangerous. It also had a weird washbasin attached to it. I was told it was NOT a bidet but a foot bath (huh?). Anyway, the common areas were decorated in a trendy style and the bar was a great place to meet up with friends. The hotel has a pool but the weather was cold so I didn't get in. My only issue was the location. It's not within walking distance to the center of town. The bus took way too long so we wound up taking cabs and splitting the cost. Also note that the hotel is located in a semi-residential area and the shops close early. We did find a late-night TGIF-style restaurant around the block though. I recommend this hotel if proximity to town is not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “OK business hotel. Fine for what it's supposed to be”
Reviews.Author: giuseppe_123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early 2004. Lobby and all public areas are very nice, new and clean. Rooms are less good and could definitely do with a makeover. Lots of use of orange, sky blue and white.....last popular in about 1972!! Pretty basic, with not much to recommend themLocation is right on the main ring road around Madrid, which makes it easy to get to from the airport ( 20 in a taxi). No noise from the motorway though.Restaurant was surprisingly good in the evening. I had one really excellent meal there. I thought the breakfast was less good, with very limited hot food, and choice in fruits and bread (although there was lots of it) is not what you'd expect in a 4 star.All in all, it does what you'd expect from a roadside business hotel. Just not somewhere for a romantic weekend!!
